gui

Class WallFollower

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractRobotDriver
      • gui.WallFollower
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotDriver

    public class WallFollower
extends AbstractRobotDriver
    The WallFollower algorithm does not rely on any knowledge of the maze beyond what the robot can see immediately around it. It traces the robot's leftward wall until an exit it found. In imperfect mazes, there is a possibility that this algorithm gets stuck on an inner wall that never touches the maze's outer wall, in which case it does not converge to the exit.
    Author:
    Elijah Mas

      • triggerUpdateSensorInformation

        public void triggerUpdateSensorInformation()
        The only thing this does is to change the value of delayExpand. Longer delay between operations when fewer sensors are enabled.
        Specified by:

      • performNextOperation

        private void performNextOperation()
        Decide on the next operation from the current position. If we can move leftwards, do so; otherwise if we can move forward, do so; if neither are possible, turn rightwards.

      • drive2Exit

        public boolean drive2Exit()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: RobotDriver
        Drives the robot towards the exit given it exists and given the robot's energy supply lasts long enough.
